title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement chris2018hou@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. title: Contributing to BiasDetect
text: outlines propose change BiasDetect. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to BiasDetect
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to BiasDetect
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to BiasDetect
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("christinehou11/BiasDetect", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to BiasDetect
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Find Bias Features - Single-nucleus RNA Sequencing Data
text: BiasDetect package developed unrelated DLPFC dataset available spatialLIBD package. first chose binomial deviance model scry feature selection method can incorporate batch variable model. Next, compared per-gene ranks dispersion values model run without batch effect. data-driven thresholding approach using cutoffs based number standard deviance (nSD) deviance rank difference metrics. Based self-selected nSD cutoffs, genes identified biased can filtered . methodology details can found Find Bias Feature written Jacqui Thompson, documentation related codes can found GitHub.

title: Find Bias Features - Single-nucleus RNA Sequencing Data
text: BiasDetect R package. Install development version GitHub:

title: Find Bias Features - Single-nucleus RNA Sequencing Data

code: if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) {     install.packages("BiocManager") }  BiocManager::install("BiasDetect")  ## Check that you have a valid Bioconductor installation BiocManager::valid() library("BiasDetect") library("SummarizedExperiment") library("SpatialExperiment")

title: Find Bias Features - Spatial Transcriptomics Data
text: BiasDetect package developed unrelated DLPFC dataset available spatialLIBD package. first chose binomial deviance model scry feature selection method can incorporate batch variable model. Next, compared per-gene ranks dispersion values model run without batch effect. data-driven thresholding approach using cutoffs based number standard deviance (nSD) deviance rank difference metrics. Based self-selected nSD cutoffs, genes identified biased can filtered . methodology details can found Find Bias Feature written Jacqui Thompson, documentation related codes can found GitHub.

title: Find Bias Features - Spatial Transcriptomics Data
text: BiasDetect R package. Install development version GitHub.

title: Find Bias Features - Spatial Transcriptomics Data
text: Install BiasDetect Load required packages
code: if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) {     install.packages("BiocManager") }  BiocManager::install("BiasDetect")  ## Check that you have a valid Bioconductor installation BiocManager::valid() library(BiasDetect) library(SpatialExperiment) library(SummarizedExperiment) library(httr)

title: Find Bias Features - Spatial Transcriptomics Data
text: spe object used tutorial stored Dropbox. object also saved ExperimentHub package named humanHippocampus2024, development version GitHub available. package publicly available, data objects can accessed via GitHub installation tutorial . dataset tutorial section spatialHPC. filtered 4 samples. ran nnSVG identify spatially-variable genes (SVGs). filtered top 2000 significant features 4 samples ’re using filterer features top 2000 >1 sample. Finally, obtained 2082 SVGs.
code: github <- "https://github.com/christinehou11/BiasDetect-analyses/" subdir <- "raw/refs/heads/main/processed-data/spatialHPC_SRT/" csv1 <- "spe-hpc_sub4_svgs-only_counts-1.csv" csv2 <- "spe-hpc_sub4_svgs-only_counts-2.csv" cdata <- "spe-hpc_sub4_svgs-only_colData.csv" rdata <- "spe-hpc_sub4_svgs-only_rowData.csv"  url1 <- paste0(github,subdir,csv1, sep = "") url2 <- paste0(github,subdir,csv2, sep = "") url3 <- paste0(github,subdir,cdata, sep = "") url4 <- paste0(github,subdir,rdata, sep = "") file1 <- read.csv(url1, row.names = 1) file2 <- read.csv(url2, row.names = 1) counts <- rbind(file1, file2) colnames(counts) = gsub("\\.","-",colnames(counts)) cdata <- read.csv(url3, row.names=1) rdata <- read.csv(url4, row.names=1) spe <- SpatialExperiment(     assay = list("counts"=counts),      colData = cdata, rowData = rdata,     spatialCoordsNames = c("array_row", "array_col")) spe class: SpatialExperiment  dim: 2082 18945  metadata(0): assays(1): counts rownames(2082): ENSG00000002330 ENSG00000002586 ... ENSG00000286214   ENSG00000286961 rowData names(6): source type ... gene_name gene_type colnames(18945): AAACAACGAATAGTTC-1_V11L05-333_B1   AAACAAGTATCTCCCA-1_V11L05-333_B1 ... TTGTTTGTATTACACG-1_V11L05-336_A1   TTGTTTGTGTAAATTC-1_V11L05-336_A1 colData names(10): sample_id slide ... expr_chrM expr_chrM_ratio reducedDimNames(0): mainExpName: NULL altExpNames(0): spatialCoords names(2) : array_row array_col imgData names(0):

title: Find Bias Features - Spatial Transcriptomics Data
text: data frame created featureSelect() function includes nSD_dev nSD_rank, can use biasDetect() function identify bias genes based self-selected nSD integer thresholds deviance rank respectively. default threshold 5 deviance 5 rank. ’s , biasDetect function allows return biased genes either data frame format plots. default format data frame. see plots, add visual = TRUE. Figure ) SVGs relative change deviance >= 10 SDs mean  Figure b) SVGs rank difference >= 5 SDs mean  Finally, can obtain newer spe_sub4 object without biased genes.
code: SVGs <- rowData(spe)$gene_id batch_df <- featureSelect(spe, batch_effect = "sample_id", VGs = SVGs) Step 1: Running feature selection without batch... Step 2: Running feature selection with batch... Step 3: Calculating deviance and rank difference... dim(batch_df) [1] 2082   10 head(batch_df)              gene gene_name dev_default rank_default dev_batch rank_batch 1 ENSG00000002330       BAD    15830.43         1310  15785.12       1289 2 ENSG00000002586      CD99    18837.21          865  18616.10        858 3 ENSG00000004059      ARF5    15033.32         1443  14985.57       1417 4 ENSG00000004660    CAMKK1    14586.54         1506  14479.27       1487 5 ENSG00000004779   NDUFAB1    19859.78          756  19469.72        764 6 ENSG00000005022   SLC25A5    16842.03         1150  16739.61       1131        d_diff     nSD_dev r_diff   nSD_rank 1 0.002870288 -0.31052071    -21 -0.4914075 2 0.011877487 -0.13869673     -7 -0.1638025 3 0.003186151 -0.30449522    -26 -0.6084093 4 0.007408683 -0.22394495    -19 -0.4446068 5 0.020034113  0.01690146      8  0.1872029 6 0.006118529 -0.24855631    -19 -0.4446068 bias <- biasDetect(batch_df = batch_df, nSD_dev = 10, nSD_rank = 5) bias           GADD45B             DUSP1              EGR1             NR4A1  "ENSG00000099860" "ENSG00000120129" "ENSG00000120738" "ENSG00000123358"               FOSB           GADD45G              EGR4              BTG2  "ENSG00000125740" "ENSG00000130222" "ENSG00000135625" "ENSG00000159388"                FOS              JUNB             NPAS4               JUN  "ENSG00000170345" "ENSG00000171223" "ENSG00000174576" "ENSG00000177606"             HSPA1B              XIST          MTRNR2L1  "ENSG00000204388" "ENSG00000229807" "ENSG00000256618" bias_fig <- biasDetect(batch_df = batch_df, nSD_dev = 10, nSD_rank = 5, visual = TRUE) bias_fig$deviance bias_fig$rank svgs_filt = setdiff(rownames(spe), bias) length(svgs_filt) [1] 2067

title: Authors and Citation
text: Christine Hou. Author, maintainer. Jacqui Thompson. Author. Stephanie C. Hicks. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hou C, Thompson J, Hicks S (2025). BiasDetect: Find Biased Features. R package version 0.99.0, https://github.com/christinehou11/BiasDetect, https://christinehou11.github.io/BiasDetect/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {BiasDetect: Find Biased Features},   author = {Christine Hou and Jacqui Thompson and Stephanie C. Hicks},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.99.0, https://github.com/christinehou11/BiasDetect},   url = {https://christinehou11.github.io/BiasDetect/}, }

title: Find Biased Features
text: BiasDetect feature-based Quality Control (QC) bias genes identification spatial transcriptomics snRNA-seq data types batch effect. BiasDetect method based binomial deviance model (Townes et al, 2019) applies cutoffs based standard deviation (SD) deviance rank difference metrics data-driven thresholding approach find batch-biased features.

title: Find Biased Features
text: BiasDetect R package available Bioconductor version 3.19 later. can install BiasDetect using following commands R session Bioconductor: Install BiasDetect Load required packages Additionally, can install development version GitHub:
code: if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) {     install.packages("BiocManager") }  BiocManager::install("BiasDetect")  ## Check that you have a valid Bioconductor installation BiocManager::valid() library("BiasDetect") library("SummarizedExperiment") library("SpatialExperiment") library("httr") BiocManager::install("christinehou11/BiasDetect")

title: Find Biased Features
text: detailed tutorial available Find Biased Features written Jacqui Thompson.

title: Find Biased Features
text: Please note BiasDetect project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Find Bias Genes — biasDetect
text: Function filter bias genes based selected selected threshold nSD deviance rank data frame plot.

title: Find Bias Genes — biasDetect
text: batch_df data.frame : Input data frame generated featureSelection() function using SpatialExperiment SingleCellExperiment object containing raw data. nSD_dev integer: Number standard deviation (nSD) deviance difference. default value 5. nSD_rank integer: Number standard deviation (nSD) rank difference. default value 5. visual logical: Whether display detected bias genes visualizations deviance rank. Default = FALSE return data frame. TRUE, returned format two parallel plots presenting bias genes based nSD_dev nSD_rank.

title: Find Bias Genes — biasDetect
text: output values identified bias genes. returned format can either data frame list two elements, giving option see either deviance rank plot.

title: Find Bias Genes — biasDetect
code: batch_df <- read.csv(system.file("extdata","hpc_srt_batch_df.csv",package = "BiasDetect"))  # data frame bias <- biasDetect(batch_df, nSD_dev = 10, nSD_rank = 5) bias #>           GADD45B             DUSP1              EGR1             NR4A1  #> "ENSG00000099860" "ENSG00000120129" "ENSG00000120738" "ENSG00000123358"  #>              FOSB           GADD45G              EGR4              BTG2  #> "ENSG00000125740" "ENSG00000130222" "ENSG00000135625" "ENSG00000159388"  #>               FOS              JUNB             NPAS4               JUN  #> "ENSG00000170345" "ENSG00000171223" "ENSG00000174576" "ENSG00000177606"  #>            HSPA1B              XIST          MTRNR2L1  #> "ENSG00000204388" "ENSG00000229807" "ENSG00000256618"   # plots bias_plot <- biasDetect(batch_df, nSD_dev = 10, nSD_rank = 5, visual = TRUE)  # deviance bias_plot$deviance  # rank bias_plot$rank

title: Feature Selection — featureSelect
text: Function conduct feature selection snRNA-seq spatial transcriptomics data calculate difference deviance rank without selected batch effect.

title: Feature Selection — featureSelect
text: input SpatialExperiment SingleCellExperiment: Input data can either SpatialExperiment SingleCellExperiment. assumed assays slot containing counts assay devianceFeatureSelection() successfully operate calculate deviance rank. logcounts strongly recommended included assays. Also, input data assumed set rownames(input) genes gene_name rowData(input). input can either raw complete data object filtered data object containing highly variable genes (HVGs) spatially varaible genes (SVGs). batch_effect character: Either batch slide subject based metadata available within input data. name slide subject within input object specified based different scenarios. VGs character: Highly Variable Genes (HVGs) SingleCelleExperiment object Spatially Variable Genes (SVGs) SpatialExperiment object. data frame, assumed contain one column identified variable genes column name gene name/ID, e.g. "ENSG00000002330".

title: Feature Selection — featureSelect
text: input provided SpatialExperiment SingleCellExperiment object, output values returned data frame containing deviance rank without bacth effect, corresponding difference, corresponding nSD, gene, gene name, whether gene outlier defined chosen deviance rank cutoff.

title: Feature Selection — featureSelect
code: github <- "https://github.com/christinehou11/BiasDetect-analyses/" subdir <- "raw/refs/heads/main/processed-data/spatialHPC_SRT/" csv1 <- "spe-hpc_sub4_svgs-only_counts-1.csv" csv2 <- "spe-hpc_sub4_svgs-only_counts-2.csv" cdata <- "spe-hpc_sub4_svgs-only_colData.csv" rdata <- "spe-hpc_sub4_svgs-only_rowData.csv"  url1 <- paste0(github,subdir,csv1, sep = "") url2 <- paste0(github,subdir,csv2, sep = "") url3 <- paste0(github,subdir,cdata, sep = "") url4 <- paste0(github,subdir,rdata, sep = "")  file1 <- read.csv(url(url1), row.names = 1) file2 <- read.csv(url(url2), row.names = 1) counts = rbind(file1, file2) colnames(counts) = gsub("\\.","-",colnames(counts)) cdata = read.csv(url(url3), row.names=1) rdata = read.csv(url(url4), row.names=1)  spe = SpatialExperiment::SpatialExperiment( assay = list("counts"=counts),  colData = cdata, rowData = rdata, spatialCoordsNames = c("array_row", "array_col"))  SVGs <- SummarizedExperiment::rowData(spe)$gene_id batch_df <- featureSelect(spe, batch_effect = "sample_id", VGs = SVGs) #> Step 1: Running feature selection without batch... #> Step 2: Running feature selection with batch... #> Step 3: Calculating deviance and rank difference...

title: BiasDetect 0.99.1
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. First full version package submitted Bioconductor.
